Text:
The Seven Shadows have decided to have a thank-you
party to show their gratitude to Shadow.

And their leader, Alpha, is facing her emotions in a
serious way.
Phew...

I still vividly remember the day Shadow saved my
life.

And when I think of what he has given me since we met
and up to now, I will never be able to repay him
fully...

The ultimate way to repay him would be to destroy the
Cult of Diablos, but daily displays of gratitude are
also valuable.
What is the most I can do for him right now?
Hmm...
Maybe...gift him something?

I could gift him one of his favorite things. That's
an oldie but a goldie.
If I had to pick a favorite of his...
Hmm...
...A Tuna King sandwich?

No, that can't be the right call here! Besides, he
eats those sandwiches all the time!
So maybe...a gold nugget?

No, no! That'll make it seem like I don't know what
Shadow likes, and I just went with some random gift!

Considering I'm the first member, I would hate for
the others to think I don't know him. Besides, if
I'm the only one among the Seven Shadows giving him a
strange gift...

(Lady Alpha, I'm surprised how little you know about
Master Shadow...)
(Lady Alpha...I'm not sure about that gift...)
(You know nothing about boss man, Lady Alpha!)
Ahh!!!
I need to take this seriously...

Let's think about it from another perspective. What
gifts would the other girls give him?

If it were Epsilon...she'd make a home-cooked meal?
That's a lovely gift unique to her that no one else
can duplicate.

As for Gamma...she'd give him some extravagant new
house? There's no way I could compete with that... I
should pay closer attention to future budget reports.

I watch the other girls closely, so it's surprisingly
easy to come up with their gifts. If anything, it's
me I know nothing about.

Alright, let's think counterintuitively. What gift
would I give myself?
If it were me...err...
Hmm...
...A Tuna King sandwich?
No! Why?! Why do I arrive at the same answer?!

Do I objectively come across as a tuna sandwich sort
of person?! ...No, it can't be that!

I mean, I'm the oldest in the Garden and strongest
after Shadow, and I've even destroyed the most Cult
bases!

I also follow up and develop strategies for urgent
missions when Gamma is absent. And when Lambda isn't
around, I even look after the other members.

I've done my best to be a versatile leader who can
hold her own in any situation. Could that versatility
be my shortcoming?!

I don't even know what I'm worrying about anymore.
*sigh* Calm down, Alpha.

My unique gift...I wonder what it could be. I guess
being good at remembering things doesn't help in
critical situations like this.

It's a shame since I've got so many memories with him
and the others...
...Memories?
...That might actually work!

Come to think of it, he seemed to enjoy listening to
our stories.

I always assumed he knew everything without hearing
it from us, but while that's true of worldly things, the
same perhaps isn't of our everyday lives. He may be
too occupied to concern himself with such things.

Maybe he expects us to grow even while we aim to
destroy the Cultnot only in fighting power but as
individuals...

How silly I have been. The things he's given me have
not always been tangible.

Of course, it's important to convey some things in a
tangible way. But that's not always the case.

Not when it comes to our memories, successes, or
failures... How about the stories from the two years
we were away from him? I have been reporting them
over time, but he doesn't know all the details.

I will put those memories and gratitude into words
and gift them to him so that they will remain in his
heart.

O-Of course, I will remind him that the best gift I
could give him is to eradicate the Cult! ...Wait, who
am I even trying to justify myself to?
Anyway, time to get back to preparing!

Alpha's footsteps convey her cheerful mood as she
returns to preparing for the party.
